abstract: The revelations that a dysfunctional board spied on its members and on journalists still casts a shadow on a company that by most measures is performing well.
snippet: The revelations that a dysfunctional board spied on its members and on journalists still casts a shadow on a company that by most measures is performing well.
lead_paragraph: Mark V. Hurd, the chairman and chief executive of Hewlett-Packard, would prefer that the discussion at the annual meeting this afternoon focus on the company’s future, not its past.

headline.main: H.P. Restarts as Spy Case Lingers On
headline.print_headline: H.P. Restarts As Spy Case Lingers On

abstract: Mark V. Hurd, the chairman and chief executive of Hewlett-Packard, would prefer that the discussion at the annual meeting Wednesday afternoon not focus on the revelations of last fall that a dysfunctional board spied on its members and on journalists.
lead_paragraph: Mark V. Hurd, the chairman and chief executive of Hewlett-Packard, would prefer that the discussion at the annual meeting Wednesday afternoon not focus on the revelations of last fall that a dysfunctional board spied on its members and on journalists.

headline.main: H.P. Restarts as Spy Case Lingers On
